intro: Nesaea candollei, commonly known as the Candolle's nesaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
